tif

Class DirectoryIFD

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.DirectoryIFD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseMetadata, Directory<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>, java.lang.Iterable<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>

    public class DirectoryIFD
extends java.lang.Object
implements Directory<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>
    Represents and manages an Image File Directory (IFD) in a TIFF file, conforming to the TIFF 6.0 specification. An IFD serves as a container for image-related data and metadata, composed of a series of tag entries that store various attributes.

    Each IFD can represent an image or a metadata structure associated with an image. Although not all directories contain pixel data, every image is described by at least one IFD.

    This implementation focuses on basic access to EXIF and standard IFD metadata entries, providing convenient methods for retrieving values in common data formats.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD

      • getNumericValue

        public java.lang.Number getNumericValue(Taggable tag)
        Retrieves the value of a tag in numeric form, if available. This method attempts to return the value of the specified tag as a Number. If the tag is not present, or the value cannot be interpreted as a numeric type, a default value of 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag for which the numeric value is requested
        Returns:
        a Number instance if the tag exists and has numeric content, otherwise, zero
